Package pfriendly

Interface IUp

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IUp3, IUpOgl, IYup2
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Up3, UpOgl, Yup2, Yup3, YupJ2, Zup3
    public interface IUp
    Maintains consistent behavior across renderers in the CamZup library. Secondarily, supports core to Processing conversions (e.g., PVector to Vec3) and altered PMatrix3D functions. (PMatrix3D is marked final and thus cannot be extended.)

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      Assumes 1920 / 1080, 1.7778 .

      Default scalar by which the height of the sketch is multiplied when the default camera function is called.

      Default far-clip when orthographic or perspective functions are called without the near and far arguments.

      Default fill color, a light blue.

      Default field of view for a perspective camera projection.
      static float DEFAULT_GLYPH_DETAIL

      Default color of the x axis when displayed by a camera's origin function.

      The scalar by which a sketch's dimensions are multiplied to find an appropriate line length.

      • DEFAULT_ASPECT

        static final float DEFAULT_ASPECT

      • DEFAULT_CAM_DIST_FAC

        static final float DEFAULT_CAM_DIST_FAC
        Default scalar by which the height of the sketch is multiplied when the default camera function is called. sqrt ( 3.0 ) / 2.0 .
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_COLOR_MAX

        static final float DEFAULT_COLOR_MAX
        The Processing default color max.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_FAR_CLIP

        static final float DEFAULT_FAR_CLIP
        Default far-clip when orthographic or perspective functions are called without the near and far arguments. 1000.0 .
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        static final int DEFAULT_FILL_COLOR
        Default fill color, a light blue.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_FOV

        static final float DEFAULT_FOV
        Default field of view for a perspective camera projection. PI / 3.0 .
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_GLYPH_DETAIL

        static final float DEFAULT_GLYPH_DETAIL
        When a non-zero value is supplied, a font glyph is flattened to line segments.

      • frustum

        static processing.core.PMatrix3D frustum​(float left,
                                         float right,
                                         float bottom,
                                         float top,
                                         float near,
                                         float far)
        Creates a view frustum given the edges of the view port.
        Parameters:
        left - the left edge of the window
        right - the right edge of the window
        bottom - the bottom edge of the window
        top - the top edge of the window
        near - the near clip plane
        far - the far clip plane
        Returns:
        the view frustum

      • getGlyph

        static java.util.List<Curve2> getGlyph​(java.awt.Font font,
                                       java.awt.font.FontRenderContext frc,
                                       java.awt.geom.AffineTransform transform,
                                       float detail,
                                       char character,
                                       java.util.List<Curve2> curves)
        A function to convert a character to an list of curve entities. A helper function for other variants of getGlyph.
        Parameters:
        font - the awt font
        frc - the font render context
        transform - the AWT affine transform
        detail - the detail
        character - the character
        curves - the list of curves
        Returns:
        the list of curves
        See Also:
        Font.createGlyphVector(FontRenderContext, char[]), GlyphVector.getOutline(), Shape.getPathIterator(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform), Shape.getPathIterator(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform, double), Font.getSize(), PathIterator.currentSegment(float[]), Vec2.mix(Vec2, Vec2, float, Vec2)

      • getGlyph

        static CurveEntity2[] getGlyph​(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics,
                               java.awt.geom.AffineTransform transform,
                               processing.core.PFont pfont,
                               float detail,
                               char... characters)
        Gets an array of curves from a PFont. The Graphics2D input can be retrieved from a PGraphicsJava2D renderer. The AffineTransform can be null.
        Parameters:
        graphics - the AWT Graphics2D
        transform - the AWT affine transform
        pfont - the PFont
        detail - the glyph detail
        characters - the characteres
        Returns:
        the array of Curve2s

      • getGlyph

        static CurveEntity2[] getGlyph​(processing.core.PFont pfont,
                               float detail,
                               char... characters)
        To convert a character to a glyph with OpenGL- based renderers, Processing uses a deprecated method from an AWT function. That method call has been isolated to this function.
        Parameters:
        pfont - the Processing font
        detail - the curve detail
        characters - the characters
        Returns:
        the array of glyphs
        See Also:
        Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit()

      • mult

        static processing.core.PMatrix3D mult​(processing.core.PMatrix3D a,
                                      processing.core.PMatrix3D b)
        Multiplies two matrices together. Matrix multiplication is not commutative, so the PMatrix3D class calls in-place multiplication "apply" and "preApply."
        Parameters:
        a - the left operand
        b - the right operand
        Returns:
        the product
        See Also:
        PMatrix3D.apply(PMatrix3D), PMatrix3D.preApply(PMatrix3D)

      • mult

        static processing.core.PMatrix3D mult​(processing.core.PMatrix3D a,
                                      processing.core.PMatrix3D b,
                                      processing.core.PMatrix3D target)
        Multiplies two matrices together. Matrix multiplication is not commutative, so the PMatrix3D class calls in-place multiplication "apply" and "preApply."
        Parameters:
        a - the left operand
        b - the right operand
        target - the output matrix
        Returns:
        the product
        See Also:
        PMatrix3D.apply(PMatrix3D), PMatrix3D.preApply(PMatrix3D)

        static processing.core.PMatrix3D orthographic​(float left,
                                              float right,
                                              float bottom,
                                              float top,
                                              float near,
                                              float far)
        Creates an orthographic projection matrix, where objects maintain their size regardless of distance from the camera.

        right - the right edge of the window
        bottom - the bottom edge of the window
        top - the top edge of the window
        near - the near clip plane
        far - the far clip plane
        Returns:
        the orthographic projection

      • perspective

        static processing.core.PMatrix3D perspective​(float fov,
                                             float aspect,
                                             float near,
                                             float far)
        Creates a perspective projection matrix, where objects nearer to the camera appear larger than objects distant from the camera.
        Parameters:
        fov - the field of view
        aspect - the aspect ratio, width over height
        near - the near clip plane
        far - the far clip plane
        Returns:
        the perspective projection

      • perspective

                                             float aspect,
                                             float near,
                                             float far,
                                             processing.core.PMatrix3D target)
        Creates a perspective projection matrix, where objects nearer to the camera appear larger than objects distant from the camera.
        Parameters:

        aspect - the aspect ratio, width over height
        near - the near clip plane
        far - the far clip plane
        target - the output matrix
        Returns:
        the perspective projection

      • rotateX

        static processing.core.PMatrix3D rotateX​(float radians)
        PMatrix3D's instance methods for rotating around orthonormal axes defer to rotation about an arbitrary axis. This is not necessary for rotate X.
        Parameters:
        radians - the angle in radians
        Returns:
        the rotation matrix

        Returns:

      • glyph

        default CurveEntity2[] glyph​(processing.core.PFont pfont,
                             float detail,
                             char... characters)
        Converts a an array of characters to a an array of curve entities. When the level of detail is 0, uses Bezier curves; when the detailis non-zero, approximates the glyph with a series of straight line segments. The PFont should have been created with createFont, not loadFont.
        Parameters:
        pfont - the PFont
        detail - the level of detail
        characters - the characters
        Returns:
        the array

      • glyph

        default CurveEntity2[] glyph​(processing.core.PFont pfont,
                             float detail,
                             java.lang.String str)
        Converts a string to a an array of curve entities. When the level of detail is 0, uses Bezier curves; when the detailis non-zero, approximates the glyph with a series of straight line segments. The PFont should have been created with createFont, not loadFont.
        Parameters:
        pfont - the PFont
        detail - the level of detail
        str - the string
        Returns:
        the array

      • lerpColor

        Color lerpColor​(Color origin,
                Color dest,
                float step,
                Color target)
        Eases from an origin color to a destination by a step.
        Parameters:
        origin - the origin color
        dest - the destination color
        step - the factor in [0, 1]
        target - the output color
        Returns:
        the color
